description:
AppImage is a universal software format for distributing portable software on Linux without needing superuser permissions to install the application. AppImage doesn’t really install software. It’s a compressed image with all the dependencies and libraries needed to run the desired software. This article looks at software that helps you manage AppImages on your system.

The post 5 Best Free and Open-Source AppImage Package Managers appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 5 Best Free and Open-Source AppImage Package Managers

description:
Managing users and their group memberships efficiently is a fundamental task in Linux and Unix system administration. In this tutorial, we will explain how to add a user to multiple groups in Linux and Unix.

The post How to Add a User to Multiple Groups in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Add a User to Multiple Groups in Linux

description:
Munin is a free and open-source system and network monitoring tool that displays system metrics in graphs through a web browser. This tutorial will show you how to install the Munin monitoring tool on Debian 12.

The post How to Install Munin Monitoring Tool on Debian 12 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Munin Monitoring Tool on Debian 12
